org.cougaar.core.servlet
Interface SimpleServletSupport

All Known Implementing Classes:
BlackboardServletSupport, SimpleServletSupportImpl
public interface SimpleServletSupport

This is a simple API for a Servlet to access COUGAAR Services, such as the Blackboard.

This is for Servlets that are loaded by the SimpleServletComponent. See SimplerServletComponent for loading details (".ini" usage, etc).

The Servlet class (e.g. "MyServlet") must have either a "support" constructor:

    ... 
    public MyServlet(SimpleServletSupport support) {
      // save support for later use
    }
    ...

or the default constructor:
    ...
    public MyServlet() {
      // load with no support
    }
    ...

The default constructor can be used to load pure Servlets (i.e. Servlets without Cougaar references).

See Also:
SimpleServletComponent

Method Detail

getPath

java.lang.String getPath()
Get the path that this Servlet was loaded under.

This can also be obtained from the HttpServletRequest.getRequestURI(), which will be "/$encoded-agent-name/path".

queryBlackboard

java.util.Collection queryBlackboard(UnaryPredicate pred)
Query the blackboard for all Objects that match the given predicate.

Each call to "query" is a snapshot of the blackboard that may contain different information than the last "query" call, even within the same Servlet "service(..)" request. The Objects returned should be considered read-only!

This is the only blackboard access that is provided to simple Servlets. Servlets that need to publish/subscribe/etc will require more complex transaction open/close logic -- they should obtain the ServletService directly. See SimpleServletComponent as a guide.

getEncodedAgentName

java.lang.String getEncodedAgentName()
Get the URL- and HTML-safe (encoded) name of the Agent that contains this Servlet instance.

Equivalent to encodeAgentName(getAgentIdentifier().getAddress()).

All "/$name/*" URLS must use the encoded Agent name. In general the raw "agentName" may contain characters that are not URL/HTML safe, such as:

  • URL reserved characters (" ", ":", "/", etc)
  • HTML reserved characters (">", "<")
  • Arbitrary control characters ("\\n", "\\t", etc)

See Also:
encodeAgentName(java.lang.String)

getAgentIdentifier

MessageAddress getAgentIdentifier()
Get the Agent's identifier for the Agent that contains this Servlet instance.

The getAgentIdentifier().getAddress() is the "raw" name of the agent and may contain unsafe URL/HTML characters.

See Also:
getEncodedAgentName()

getLog

LoggingService getLog()
Obtain access to the logging service.

This is guaranteed to be non-null.

encodeAgentName

java.lang.String encodeAgentName(java.lang.String name)
Utility method to encode an Agent name -- equivalent to java.net.URLEncoder.encode(name).

See Also:
getEncodedAgentName()
